text: so how bad is the situation in Greece as
we can see in the graph Greece's debt as
a proportion of its economy is the

Greece get to this point while Greeks
may work some of the longest hours but
they are not nearly as productive as
their neighbors say for example every
hour a Greek works it's worth almost
half the value is their German
counterpart to put this in context that
Greece has a large public sector to
support unemployment is the highest in
Europe so one in two young people don't
have a job Greece also has a big black
market in 2015 it represented 22% of its
economy so in real terms the Greek
government is missing out on taxes and
contributions on at least a fifth of
transactions all this means there's not
very much going in to government coffers
so if Greece does default who will lose
out Germany has the most funds tied up
but interestingly another victim could
be Slovenia risking 2.6 percent of its
economy in the clan the prospects for
